reviewText:
Ashes of Immortality is one of the most amateur games I've played in a loooong time. Basically, a generic RPG with no testing, lacking originality, and that seems to have been as rushed as it could.

Pros & Cons:

+ Can be a 8-10 hour distraction if you take it casually as a Solitaire game

- A lot of generic art and music that I recognize from other games, probably from RPGM packs
- Story is all over the place and tries too hard to rely just on featuring vampires
- Characters are very clich√© and underdeveloped
- Battle is completely unbalanced, and you basically just attack, except on some bosses, and when the difficulty suddenly skyrockets when you get to some new areas
- Invisible walls in the middle of the path, passable walls that shouldn't be
- Almost no equipment and the economy is a mess
- I managed to skip to the final boss without doing some mandatory" stuff near the end
- Sometimes you get no or almost no clue as to what to do next
- I did one side-quest near the end that brought me from lv 30-ish to lv 99
date: basically ruining the end game\n- One of the worst
recommended: most unrewarding endings I've ever seen.\n\nI could go on and on listing cons
hoursPlayed: but that should be enough. And all those positive reviews... they're either blind fans
votesHelpful: VERY low standards.\nI have AoI 2 as well
votesTotal: and I think I'll try it someday
column17: don't buy it unless you just want the cards.\n\nEdit: After playing AoI2 for about 3 hours
column19: it's abysmal! Don't bother with this series."

reviewText:
With every 16-bit type rpg one of the most important elements is the story ---- the fundamental narrative to maintain interest, the pacing to avoid boredom, and the character development to add some fun are all very important, and all of these aspects are nicely tied together in Ashes of Immortality".


The game is quick to start and the first dungeon of many is at hand
date: and the adventure begins as Simona (a hunter) travels throughout a large world inhabited by vampires of all types
voteText:
and a host of other supernatural creatures. She will recruit allies along the way each of whom has their own story to explore as bonds are formed and personalities develop.


There are many battles along the way
helpfulPercent: but they never overpower the actual story
votesHelpful: and the game does a good job of keeping your interest in what is going to happen next ---- and there are
votesFunny:
lots of surprises.


Each area is nicely presented ---- towns
column17:
etc. ---- and all need to be carefully explored for the treasures to be found.


Music is nicely done
column18:
stays in the background yet adds to the structure of the game.


In addition to the main story
column19: there are many side quests to do
column20:
all of which offer good rewards for completion.


All of the characters
column24:
and are easy to like ---- even the somewhat eccentric ones.


There are a great many things to like here
column25: and I think anyone that enjoys the 16-bit type rpgs will have a great time with  this well told tale.\n"

reviewText: If you like the classic rpg game, this was a pretty sweet game.  I rather enjoyed the storyline and how it got all these different people to interact.  It was a rather solid story with cool game play.  THere was some lack of guiding, but it was a pretty awesome game, overall.
voteText: 12 of 19 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I finished this game around a week ago, and like Black Home I just can't recommend this not because it's a RPGMaker game, but because of basic flaws in the game.\n\nThis game once more it's due to the endgame I can't recommend it.  Once you get this game's 'airship' you can fly STRAIGHT to the final dungeon and tackle the final boss, however despite the fact this is a sequence break which I LOVE this does the worst sin of a sequence break, if you do this you miss out on the last big section of the game's story to the point that you miss a good portion of the game's story.  To the point the game feels unfinished and unpolished, the game is fun to play just the ending fell flat.

reviewText: A fun little game, similar to many other RPGmaker games but with a supernatural twist.

reviewText: Ashes of Immortality is a fun little RPG.  It's got references to virtually all of the major vampire fictions (Buffy, Dracula), and is very funny.  The gameplay is fairly standard, but enjoyable.  I recommend this game!

reviewText: I am a sucker for old school RPGs.  The plot seems to be well thought out, even a fine mix of humor built in.  I like the characters and battle system.  If there was a flaw it would be the mob lists.  Dungeons consists solely of the same encounters over and over until you get to the boss/end.  Other than that, I love it.

reviewText: Flickering screen issue with nvidia grapics cards makes the game unplayable. Tried some of the things suggested in the online forums to no avail. Don't buy if you have an nvidia graphics card.\n\nEDIT: tried playing the game again recently and it's working now! Fun so far!

Ashes of Immortality is a short RPGMaker game about the fight between The Family and Vampires.
The Family is a group of hunters killing everything not normal.
And you are a female member of this Family. Oh, and you are in search of your father.
During your search you  find companions. Most bizarre companions like a Vampire, an half Vampire and
another member of The Family (who wants to get you back for judgement).
The story, even if not new, is fun enough. In the dungeons you solve a few and easy switch puzzles, find new
equipment and kill monsters.
Oh, and there are a handful of side-quests and of course the long collecting quest.

It was fun playing the game...till you got your airplane (a big bat). With it you can visit all loacations.
And....there is this one location with Dracula...if you beat him...booom you are max level and rich.
OK, there is another location where you can fight against boss monsters (including Dracula again).
But at that point the fighting is useless. The enemies can't hurt you anymore....I fought Dracula and
paralyzed him...even with 50K Hitpoints it was over in a few minutes and he didn't hit my party once.
Oh, and don't miss a nice reunion for one of your party members.

Would I recommend this game? Yes, till the not so good end it was fun.
